questions.question: The village ................................ I was born is a few hundred miles from here.
This is the store in ................................ I used to work.
questions.description: In which is similar to where. We cannot use that after a preposition.

questions.question: He was admired by the people with ............................... he worked.
questions.description: In a formal style, the preposition comes before the relative pronoun.

questions.question: He was loved by the people ................................. he worked with.
questions.description: In an informal style, the preposition goes at the end of the sentence.

questions.question: This is the room .................................... I was born in.
questions.description: That is used when the preposition goes at the end. It cannot be used after a preposition.

questions.question: Do you know ................................ country she is from?
He always quarreled with the people with ................................... he worked.
questions.description: We cannot use who and that after prepositions.

questions.question: Do you know …………………………. I met at the club yesterday?
questions.description: In an informal style who is also possible here.

questions.question: You should give me …………………………. I want.
